message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to each of the 10 statements about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Costa Rica. Let me think through each statement carefully based on my perspective as an educator:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - I would agree with this, as AI tools can provide ideas and suggestions for lesson planning.

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - I would agree with this, as AI can personalize content based on student needs.

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - I would agree with this, as AI tools can provide personalized feedback and support.

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - I would agree with this, as AI can help with translation for multilingual learners and provide support for special education needs.

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - I would strongly agree with this, as this is a clear benefit I've observed.

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern/negative statement. I would agree that this is a real risk with AI tools like ChatGPT.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - I would agree with this, as AI is not always accurate and can provide misleading information.

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a valid concern. I would agree with this statement.

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a legitimate concern. I would agree with this.

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students - This is possible. I would agree that this is a concern.

Let me formulate my responses as a Costa Rican teacher with balanced perspectives on both the benefits and risks of AI:
